botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Regal pelargoniums are evergreen perennials or subshrubs, bushy in habit, with rounded, often lobed leaves and usually single flowers to 4cm across, borne in clusters in late spring and into summer, in shades of pink, red, orange and purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Remove spent flowers. To overwinter, grow small plants in late summer from cuttings. See Pelargonium cultivation for further advice.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in summer and overwinter plants in frost free conditions or propagate by softwood cuttings in spring
how_to_grow.pests: Leafhoppers, vine weevils, caterpillars, thrips, fungus gnats, glasshouse whitefly and aphids can be troublesome
how_to_grow.diseases: Foot and root rots and grey moulds are often troublesome in wet conditions. A virus may occur, particularly where cultivars are maintained by cuttings
